(a) i = 8; j = 9;
printf("%d", i >> 1 + j >> 1);

ans: 0
i: 0000000000001000
j: 0000000000001001
|
v
i: 0000000000000000

expl: the bits in i are shifted right 10 times and then one more time.

(b) i = 1;
printf("%d", i & ~i);

0000000000000001
&
1111111111111110
|
v
ans: 0

(c) i = 2; j = 1; k = 0;
printf("%d", ~i & j ^ k);

1111111111111101
&
0000000000000001
^
0000000000000000
|
v
0000000000000001
^
0000000000000000
|
v
0000000000000001

ans: 1

(d) i = 7; j = 8; k = 9;
printf("%d", i ^ j & k);

0000000000000111
^
0000000000001000
&
0000000000001001
|
v
0000000000000111
^
0000000000001000
|
v
0000000000001111

ans: 15
